alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued September 19 at 3:30AM PDT until September 21 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MOSQUITO BURN SCAR NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Ash and debris flows caused by moderate to heavy showers and thunderstorms over the Mosquito burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Motherlode and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...Through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy rainfall over the Mosquito burn scar is expected through Tuesday. Residents near the Mosquito burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Areas with steep terrain ill have a greater risk for ash and debris flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service meteorologists are forecasting thunderstorms over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
